entry.title: Re: Equivalent of: Call Function... In update task
entry.content:
I am familiar with it and I understand your end goal. But what I am saying is that I haven't found a clean core solution for this yet. Unfortunately, there are a lot of restrictions in place to achieving this, we can only be creative with our solution and see what works for now. the bgpf has both controlled and uncontrolled version. The "controlled" version is supposed to be the solution for bundling the updates where we have a MODIFY and SAVE phase. However, the controlled version also has its own restrictions related to released RAP BO consumption. 

Let me know if you found a better solution to this, it would be a very big help.

entry.title: Re: How to CAST a CHAR(12) field to CHAR(10) and use it i...
entry.content:
Not sure why you faced any issues. This 👇works on Public Cloud 2508:

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'PO'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
  serviceQuality: #X,
  sizeCategory: #S,
  dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity zipo
  as select from I_PurchaseOrderAPI01 as new
    join         I_PurchaseOrderAPI01 as old on new.PurchaseOrder = substring(
      old.CorrespncExternalReference, 1, 10
    )
{
  new.PurchaseOrder,
  old.PurchaseOrder as OldPurchaseOrder
}

entry.title: Crystal Reports: ToWords with UFL to change language
entry.content:
Hello all,

I'm using the ToWords function in a report that is in spanish.  That part works fine but I'd like change the language according to a parameter in a SAP document.  In other words, one document calls a report in English and another calls a report in spanish.

My understanding about ToWords function is that it detects the locale in the server environment and choose the language accordingly.  As a result, you cannot control the language from the formula of report.  I've found several Q&A and the solution is always to create a long formula to translate a number to words on its own code.

I think it's possible to specifically call crtowords_en.dll from C# and make it an UFL.  What would you think?  If yes, I'd like an information of how to declare the method together with DllImport that would look something like this.

[DllImport("User32.dll")] static extern Boolean MessageBeep(UInt32 beepType);

Could someone help me?

Thank you for your help in advance.

Regards,

Koichi

entry.title: Re: Procurement via Service Order initiated by Solution O...
entry.content:
Hello @Sorosch_Sakhiza,

Is my understanding correct that the service contract was already sold before the solution order and follow-up service order is created?

If yes, the spare part item in the solution order as well as in the follow-up service order is linked to the service contract item. Price agreements maintained in the assigned service contract (item) will be applied. In case 100% discount is applied, your service order items will result in a zero net value invoice. Same applies if you do not maintain price agreements but you use "Accounting Indicator" to set 100% discount. Today, there is no way to prevent the billing process completly when creating a service orde from solution order.

In future, it's planned to offer non-billable item categories in service orders. This item categories are not relevant for billing (thanks @Chris1973 for sharing). I am not aware that those non-billable item categories will be available in solution order too. Therefore, I recommend you to raise this requirement in the customer influence portal (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Sales).

Moreover, please be aware that the process to procure a phasical material does not include service entry sheet but goods receipt posting. Service entry sheet is only used when procuring a service (external service item in service order).

Please let me know if this answers your question.

Best regards,
Julius - SAP Cloud ERP Consulting

entry.title: Re: purchase order formsediting or making changes
entry.content:
Hello @Damien_genU 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, Adobe LiveCycle Designer is the only supported tool for editing XDP form templates used by SAP Forms Service by Adobe. Other editors can open the files but cannot preserve data bindings or logic at runtime.

If you are looking for more flexibility, you can Build or extend forms using SAP Forms Service by Adobe on SAP BTP, or use SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) templates for regulatory output.

With kind regards

Chuma

Common FQEvents for Revenue Accounting:

  • FQEvent 1150: This event is used for account determination and can also be extended for custom logic related to RA flags.

entry.title: Re: Credit management - SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Tehreem_Fatima1 

Credit consumption is inherently linked to the Payer’s credit account. To affect the sold-to’s account, either designate the sold-to as the payer or use a parent–child hierarchy to combine exposure to the sold-to (parent) BP.

SAP-useful official documentation

SAP Help (Public Cloud): Managing Credit Exposures states credit exposure is calculated for the payer in the relevant credit segment. This explains why exposure/limit follows the payer unless you model a hierarchy. SAP Help Portal-Managing Credit Exposures

KBA 3556889 explains credit limit calculation for parent and child customers in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. It shows how to support rolling up exposure to the parent, such as assigning check rules to check only the parent. Clear, cloud-specific guidance.

SAP Support Portal-3556889 - Credit Limit Calculation Issue for Parent and Child Customers in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

If you require a secondary KBA for hierarchy setup, refer to 2706299, which details the parent–child relationship of BPs for credit checks in FSCM.SAP Support Portal-2706299 - Parent-child relationship of business partners for credit check in SAP Credit Management (FSCM)

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Condition type change not creating change documents i...
entry.content:
Good day @Anurag_NP 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at how Print-relevant purchasing document changes trigger printout for more details.

When you change a custom pricing condition rate in a purchase order in public cloud, no change document is created because the KNOV fields for custom condition types are not automatically flagged as change relevant. However, you can enable this:

Go to CBC à Procurement à Purchase Orders à Define Print-Relevant Changes

Add table KONV, field KBETR and your custom condition type.

Retest it and the system will now recognise condition rate changes for output/print tracking.

Alternatively, you can also use the Display Changes to Purchasing Documents app for review or BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_CHANGE_MONITOR for custom change handling

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: 1,500× Faster: ABAP Cloud API with “Just” Gzip
entry.content:
@Sandra_Rossi thank you very much!
So to answer your question, I think it won't be much slower, but ~33% slower because of the Base64 increase in size, but this is just a theoretic assumption, which I'm not a huge fan of 😅, to have a clear answer I'd need to just implement a small PoC and profile it. But could you explain why there's the need for Base64?

Regarding double compression, as far as I know setting the response header of the HTTP service to "Content-Encoding: gzip" doesn't compress the data out of the box, you still need to handle the compression manually, similarly how "Content-Type: application/json" won't serialize it to a JSON. But I will try it out and see if there's some magic😅 I plan to come up with a follow-up for this post because actually there's one better(more standard) way of exposing a simple OData service, and just asking for the compressed data by setting the request header to "Content-Encoding: gzip"

entry.title: Re: Automatic Attachment Transfer from Quality Notificati...
entry.content:
Good day @Sayani1 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, in public cloud, you cannot automatically transfer attachment from a Quality Notification to the Service Entry Sheet (SES). Attachments are stored object-specifically and you cannot transfer them across business objects unless standard integrations exist. What you can do is:

  • Reference the same Document Info Record through SAP Document Management Service, or
  • Make use of the In-App Extensibility (custom logic) if a released BAdI exist for SES processing.

Currently, this functionality is not supported by default, and no standard configuration exist to enable it.

Have a look at Quality Notifications, Service Entry Sheet & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/8ebfbe6ed21045e09ae1369bc63e09f4.html?locale=en-US&version=2508.00 for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to configure payment method for cash payment when...
entry.content:
Good day @yahaha 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, there is no predefined cash payment method in public cloud because cash transaction are not process through the automatic payment program (APP). Instead, SAP provides the Cash Journal app that you can use to record all cash related receipts and payments.

If your business process requires a Cash classification in vendor or customer master data, you have the possibility to create a symbolic payment method by using the Set Up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region. Make sure it is not linked to any payment medium program.

Alternatively, you can record cash payments manually by using the Post General Journal Entries.

Have a look at the following references for more details:

Automatic Payments – Set Up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region for Payment Transactions

Post Cash Journal Entries, Configuring Payment Methods & Post General Journal Entries

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Deploying a node.js application on Cloud Foundry for file uploads to Amazon S3
entry.content: Brilliant blog

entry.title: Re: What are the most effective approaches for planning a...
entry.content:
Hello @aliveallen360 

That is a relevant question: large-scale modernisation succeeds as a strategic transformation, not just a technical rewrite.

Here is some useful SAP Documentation to help structure the best approach that works well in real projects

Start with a Portfolio Assessment

  • Apply a business and technical perspective: assess each application for business value, technical debt, and strategic fit.
  • Categorise into: Rehost, Replatform, Refactor, or Replace the 6Rs model.
  • Modernise where ROI and agility gain are highest, not where the code is easiest.

Define an Architecture Target

  • Shift towards modular, API-led design.
  • Implement containerisation (Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry) for portability.
  • Introduce microservices gradually rather than decomposing everything at once.
  • Set up a data integration layer early, as legacy systems usually face difficulties at this stage.

Adopt DevOps and Automation Early

  • Continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines reduce migration risk.
  • Infrastructure-as-Code Terraform, BTP, or hyperscaler tools ensures consistency.
  • Include automated testing and observability logging, tracing, metrics from day one.

Prioritise Security and Stability

  • Modernise around identity, API security, and compliance first.
  • Run pilot workloads in parallel before full cutover; hybrid coexistence is often necessary for months.

Manage Change and Skills

  • Modernisation isn’t only about technology; train the teams in cloud ops, container orchestration, and agile delivery.
  • Use cross-functional squads combining IT and business SMEs.

Common pitfalls to avoid

  • Trying to microservice everything at once.
  • Underestimating data migration and dependency mapping.
  • Ignoring cultural change ,DevOps adoption fails if ownership stays siloed.

Useful SAP Documentation

SAP Press Guide: SAP S/4HANA System Conversion and Modernisation

SAP Help Portal: Application Modernisation and Cloud Transformation

SAP Help Portal Migration Guide for SAP Process Orchestration-Modernization Recommendations

SAP Discovery Center Missions: Modernize Applications with SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime & Cloud Foundry

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to list WBS Elemen...
entry.content:
Good day @Wayne10 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at WBS Elements, Project Control - Enterprise Projects & Custom Analytical Queries for more details.

To summarise, there is no single app that lists all WBS element details in one view by default in public cloud. However, you can achieve your target by using standard tools such as:

  • Display WBS Element or Project Control-Projects for standard reporting.
  • Custom Analytical Queries by using CDS view I_WBSelement to include your company code and functional area.
  • Project System-Reporting Overview to enable you generate aggregated reporting

I recommend using the Custom Analytical Queries with released CDS view because it provides flexibility to include all required fields and publish the report as s Fiori tile. Also, it adheres to the clean-core methodology.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Warehouse management storage bin (Cloud Public Edition)
entry.content:
Good day @bicoriolano 

Thank you for your question.

Have you had a look at Supply chain management packages and pricing?

In summary, Supply Chain Premium includes all the capabilities of the base plus additional advance features such as sustainability and compliance. However, the public documentation does not explicitly confirm that warehouse bin suggestion or location detection logic is included in the base.

If you want a guaranteed access to advance allocation or bin suggestion logic, I believe the premium is the safer choice.

Before you commit, make sure to check whether your current tenant/license scope already has that function enabled by testing or by reaching out to SAP support. If it is not present, then upgrading will ensure you have no missing features.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

  • Reference the same Document Info Record through SAP Document Management Service, or

Currently, this functionality is not supported by default, and no standard configuration exist to enable it.

Have a look at Quality Notifications, Service Entry Sheet & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/8ebfbe6ed21045e09ae1369b... for more details.

entry.title: Re: Rental process through solution order - how to manage...
entry.content:
Hello @snigdhodeep 

Great question, and your screenshots are helpful. In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the leading practice is

Receive the rented unit back (no refund)

Customer Returns and Advanced Returns: How to create Customer Return, set Return Decision (No refund), create Inbound Delivery, and Post Goods Receipt to transfer stock from customer to inventory.  SAP Help Portal

Bill the customer for rental/usage

Pick the option that fits how you charge:

Documents periodic/milestone and ad-hoc billing for service contracts, useful for flat rate charges per period. SAP Help Portal

Guide for Solution Orders in SAP Subscription Billing: Subscription and usage-based billing methods, SAP Help Portal

Optional background on Solution Orders: review collections or videos from SAP Product Success for a primer. SAP Community-Solution Order Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - The Collection Blog

Note:If a customer returns the asset without a refund, a Contract or Subscription will be charged for rental or usage. Avoid using sales returns that generate credits, as this is not a complaint or quality return.

Let me know if you need further information

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports: ToWords with UFL to change language
entry.content:
Yes, a UFL can indeed handle this use case. But the devil is in the detail:
- integers or decimals?
- need to handle number gender?
- number or currency?
- output format options?

If Crystal ToWords() works well enough for  your use case, you could use a UFL that can translate the output in the default language to the desired language. There are 3rd-party UFLs that provide such a function.

A third option, if the machine has the target language installed, is to direct the Crystal runtime to switch to the other locale.

entry.title: BYD: Internal Sales Note copied to Journal Entry Header
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

if we maintain an "Internal Sales" on the customer account on the tab "Notes" it gets written to the sales order as an "Internal Comment", then to the customer invoice and to the journal entry header and line item text as well.
How can we configure this system behavior? We do not want to have the internal sales note from the customer account on the journal entry text.

Thanks.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: BYD: Internal Sales Note copied to Journal Entry Header
entry.content:
Dear requester,

When in the customer invoice, the Internal Comments in header is the only maintained note field, it will be taken into the JE.

When the Internal Comments and Customer Info notes are maintained in the same time, Internal Comments has higher priority and will be taken into the JE.

When the user firstly maintained the internal comment and clicked SAVE. Then added customer information and clicked SAVE. these 2 notes were saved in 2 different changes. In this case, the 2nd added note which is Customer Info in this case will be taken into the JE.

it is the designed behavior. There is no configuration activity or rules to change this logic so far in the system.

Thanks,

Adie

entry.title: How to make MRP Strategy 10 ignore special procurement requirements from other plant
entry.content:
Dear expert,

I encountered an issue in a Public Cloud case and would like to seek advice from the experts here.
The customer’s business model is that the demand plant issues purchase orders to the supplying plant. Independent requirements are created directly in the supplying plant. The customer wants the production plan to follow the independent requirements only, so they intend to use MRP Strategy 10.

However, we discovered an issue : even if the supplying plant uses MRP type 10, even though the supplying plant uses MRP Strategy 10, once the demand plant issues an inter-plant purchase order, the purchase requirements are still transferred to the supplying plant. As a result, during MRP calculation, the supplying plant generates additional production quantities based on those purchase order requirements.

For example, if the supplying plant independently plans to produce 500 EA and the receiving plant creates an inter-plant purchase requisition for 100 PCS, after the MRP run, the supplying plant will generate planned orders for 600 PCS, resulting in an extra 100 PCS being produced.

I tried adjusting the Mixed MRP setting and the Consumption Indicator, but neither seems to resolve the issue.

 

 

Best regards,

Lance

entry.title: Re: Equivalent of: Call Function... In update task
entry.content:
Hello Juwin,

If you are calling I_BillingDocumentTP inside your custom RAP BO , once the call is successful without any failed entries , you can directly update the custom table using Unmanaged save in your RAP BO . 
Another solution would be to use Local Consumption of RAP Business Events (Database Table Modification) to update your custom table.

Best Regards,

Siva

entry.title: Re: Migration to S/$ Hana
entry.content:
Hello @piyush_kr ,

 

AspectDetails
PossibilityYes — you can introduce a new currency type during or after SAP S/4HANA migration. The approach depends on whether it’s a Brownfield (system conversion) or Greenfield (new implementation) project.
Common Currency Types10 – Company Code Currency (Local) 20 – Controlling Area Currency 30 – Group Currency 40+ – Custom / Freely Defined Currency Types
Migration Approach: Greenfield (New Implementation)- New system setup allows defining all currency types freely. - No restriction since historical data is not migrated. - Define currencies in configuration (OB22, FINSC_LEDGER, FINSC_FISCYEAR).
Migration Approach: Brownfield (System Conversion)- Possible to add new currencies (e.g., Group Currency) using SAP’s currency conversion process. - Requires data conversion and recalculation of historical data. - Executed via SAP guided tools such as FINS_CURRENCY.
Tool / TransactionFINS_CURRENCY – SAP’s Currency Conversion tool for adding new currency types post-migration.
Key SAP Notes2344014 – Currency Conversion in SAP S/4HANA 2549494 – Adding Additional Currency in Universal Journal after Migration
Impact Areas- General Ledger (ACDOCA) - Asset Accounting - CO-PA (Profitability Analysis) - Material Ledger - Group Reporting
Configuration Adjustments- Ledger setup – FINSC_LEDGER - Currency settings – OB22 - Currency translation – OB08, OBBS
Best Practice- Introduce new currency before migration if possible. - If added post-migration, first test in a sandbox or quality system. - Validate balances, ledgers, and reports after conversion.
Risks / Cautions- Impacts historical ledgers and financial reports. - Requires system backup and reconciliation across ACDOCA, Asset Accounting, CO, and Material Ledger.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Sucessfully automated updating Confirmation Tab of ME22N but stops on 9th row
entry.content:
Hi

I made a macro that: 


After  downloading Me5A excel file and pasting it at the macro file, you can edit Delivery dates at downloaded Excel.
After  updating, it copies the delivery dates from excel to Confirmation Tab>Field named EEIND
Since one material number appears at one time, after updating the first material number, it switches over to the 2nd material then updates that, switch to 3rd material updates that and so on.

And the macro works until..it reaches the 9th material.


After it updates the 9th material number, it attempts to switch to the 10th, fails to do so, "updates" EEIND using 10th material data [9th EEIND gets overwritten], attempts again for the 11th material but 9th material is still visible, overwrites the data and so on (ᗒᗣᗕ)

Here is the function that presses the drop down boxes and dynamically chooses what material number using cmbDYN_6000-LIST (The drop down box under "Item Details").

Macro 1 below

======================================
This Function basically just sets up choosing material number at the  dropdown box by giving it  3 spaces and assigning what are reserving thoses spaces as what row are we know (comboIndex). So basically it just prepares this: 

session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0019/.............../cmbDYN_6000-LIST").key = "<space, space, space> " and spaces will be replaced later.

Example:  we are updating uisng excel's row 3 now, next row is row number 4. After you are done updating SAP using data at excel's row 3, you will now move on to material  4.

So you put "  4" replacing the 3 spaces
session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0019/.............../cmbDYN_6000-LIST").key = "  4"
Row 4 is the result of comboIndex

=========================================
Start Macro 1



Function PressDynamicAutotext(sess As Object, ws As Worksheet, excelRow As Long, comboIndex As Long) As Boolean
Dim ctrl As Object
On Error Resume Next

Set ctrl = sess.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0019/subSUB3:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/" & _
"subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1301/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:6000/cmbDYN_6000-LIST")
If ctrl Is Nothing Then ws.Cells(excelRow, ERR_COL).Value = "Dynamic combo not found": PressDynamicAutotext = False: Exit Function


ctrl.SetFocus
ctrl.Key = " " & comboIndex
ctrl.SetFocus
ctrl.Key = " " & comboIndex
application.Wait Now + (0.35 / 86400#) '------------------------- I added wait time. I only have 8GB ram. I'm sorry for being poor.
PressDynamicAutotext = True

----------------------------------------------

This is troubleshooting line. I want to see if the button is successfully pressed so I put it at excel. That is why I know it did the "press" attempt. I will delete this line if everything works well

----------------------------------------------
ws.Cells(excelRow, LOG_COL).Value = ws.Cells(excelRow, LOG_COL).Value & " | Dynamic Autotext " & comboIndex & " pressed"
On Error GoTo 0
End Function

Snippet of Macro 2 below 
===============
What this does is anayze ComboIndex. Combo index is based on a counter scrollCounter = scrollCounter + 1.  It is +1 since we do not need to choose material number since it is already displayed once PO is displayed. 

First 2 lines are  just my log  in excel. 
=================
Start of part of Macro 2
...... 


If Not PressDynamicAutotext(sess, ws, i, scrollCounter) Then ws.Cells(i, ERR_COL).Value = "Dynamic Autotext failed"
If Not WaitForStatusBarClearSafe(sess) Then ws.Cells(i, ERR_COL).Value = "Status bar didn't clear after dynamic autotext"
application.Wait Now + (0.35 / 86400#)
scrollCounter = scrollCounter + 1 ' increment for next table row

NextRow:
application.Wait Now + (0.1 / 86400#)
Set targetTable = Nothing: Set targetAB = Nothing: Set targetEEIND = Nothing: Set cmb = Nothing: Set UserArea = Nothing
Next i

========================================
Again it worked for the first 9 material number but failed on 10th onwards.

I tried adding a pause after 9th row [and pauses again on the 18th] , pop up a dialog box to tell user choose material 10 manually, press ok to continue macro. But it it know got stuck on the 10th material 😞

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Demand forecasting for festivals
entry.content:
Hi Prabhat
Please follow the steps below:
1. Create a key figure indicating the festive period like month/weeks of Diwali by a binary value in past and future.

2. In the 'Manage Forecast Models' app, select models such as Multiple Linear Regression or Gradient Boosting.

3. Add your event variables (the indicators you created) as independent variables (exogenous regressors)

As a result in next forecast run system will learn the sales (or demand) uplift or pattern associated with unique event codes or indicators, even though the holidays shift from year to year. In future forecasts will be generated based on the  the event indicator. In your case for forecast periods where Diwali will occur.

I would recommend to use Gradient Boosting for its capability to handle categorical inputs representing events, which is superior for non-linear holiday effects.

Hope this helps.

-Rahul Mohnot

entry.title: Re: Planner method, cumulative hierarchy, and/or standard...

Good afternoon Xavier,

I hereby inform you that, prior to performing the bulk upload using the CSV file to select supervisors, when the spreadsheet is launched by selecting the superior in the accumulated hierarchy, it generates the spreadsheet for this user with their respective collaborators or first-level supervisors, as evidenced in the following image:

 Once the instructions referred to in the video regarding the bulk upload of supervisors using the CSV file were followed, the following change was generated: the number of direct collaborators of the hierarchy supervisor has changed. According to the structure established in EC and the eligibility rule, this number increases to 24 after the upload, as evidenced in the following image:

 Likewise, the client requires the bulk upload of supervisors to be performed. This process does not modify the correct functioning of the hierarchy. The hierarchy supervisor's spreadsheet is sent to the first-level supervisors, and these are sent to the first-level supervisors. All employees, regardless of whether they are supervisors or employees, report to you.

I remain attentive.

Sincerely,

entry.title: Re: How to enter Attribute on aggregated level to get it...
entry.content:
Hi BR, Halyna,

There are two ways to accomplish what you want, 

Option1:  Through "Manage Rules for Master Data" app-

Step1: You create an attribute for example "LOCPRODDESIREDATTR" in LOCATIONPRODUCT master data

Step2: Create a Rule for LOCATIONPRODUCT master data with Filter condition on LOCATION master attribute "DESIREDATTR" >=0 

Step3: Create join condition between Location and LocationProduct master data.

Step4: LOCPRODDESIREDATTR = DESIREDATTR

if you are new to this please use link : https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_INTEGRATED_BUSINESS_PLANNING/feae3cea3cc549aaa9d9de7d363a83e6/ee1f6ace105b4a8e9a527b9b2bb9b778.html?q=maintain+Master+Data+Rule

Option2:  Through Attribute as Key figure and using indirect input at LOCPROD level to extend the Location level value to LocationProduct level

Step1 : Create attribute as key figure for DESIREDATTR@WKLOC level

Step2: Create additional calculation in same Key Figure DESIREDATTR@WKLOCPROD using indirect input as any key figure Like: IndependentDemand, DependentDemand which is at the same planning level and you are sure that it will have planning object generated during the planning process.

You can use this additional calculation in another Key figure with same planning level with equal operator or in calculation wherever you want.

 

Hope this helps,

-Rahul Mohnot

entry.title: Email triggers - removal of registration in Pending status
entry.content:
When removing one participant from a class who is sitting in the pending status (awaiting chief approval), it triggers the Learning event cancellation email to be sent to the user, manager and facilitator (including the calendar invite removing the item from the facilitators calendar). 

If I follow the same steps and remove someone who is actively enrolled in the class, it triggers the class withdrawal emails. 

I need to understand the logic behind this? I've been told it is expected system behaviour but why would I want to trigger an email that the class has been cancelled when removing one attendee. 

The process I'm following to remove people from the class is: Opening the class in SF, clicking the three dots next to the name in the registration tab and selecting remove.

entry.title: SAP GUI 7.70 – Cannot Record Script or Capture Controls in PI Sheet
entry.content:
大家好，

我目前在Windows 11 Enterprise 23H2（Build 22631）上使用适用于 Windows 7.70（补丁级别 7）的 SAP GUI。脚本功能在大多数事务中都能正常工作——我可以毫无问题地录制脚本并获取控制 ID。

但是，当我打开PI 表时，脚本录制和回放功能会生成一个空白脚本。
没有任何操作或控件被录制，即使在其他事务中相同的功能运行正常。

有趣的是，我以前用旧版本（可能是相同的 GUI 版本，但补丁级别不同）在 PI Sheet 中成功录制了脚本。
这意味着系统和授权都正常——只是PI Sheet 脚本界面现在好像有点问题。

以下是我已经检查过的内容：

  • ✅ 客户端脚本已启用（Options > Accessibility & Scripting > Enable Scripting）

  • ✅ 服务器端参数sapgui/user_scripting = TRUE

  • 🖥️ 其他 SAP 交易（如 ME21N、CO03 等）可以毫无问题地记录

  • ⚠️ 只有PI Sheet无法生成任何脚本输出

我的问题是：
👉 这是某些 SAP GUI 7.70 补丁版本中的已知限制或错误吗？
👉 哪个补丁版本或配置允许再次使用 PI Sheet 脚本？
👉 我是否需要降级或升级 GUI（例如，补丁版本 15 或 GUI 8.00）？

任何建议或解决方法都将不胜感激！
提前谢谢您。

谨致问候，
Sosan

entry.title: SAP GUI 7.70 – Cannot Record Script or Capture Controls in PI Sheet
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently using SAP GUI for Windows 7.70 (Patch Level 7) on Windows 11 Enterprise 23H2 (Build 22631).
The scripting function works normally for most transactions — I can record scripts and get control IDs without any issue.

However, when I open a PI Sheet, the Script Recording and Playback feature produces a blank script.
No actions or controls are recorded, even though the same feature works fine in other transactions.

Interestingly, I used to record scripts in PI Sheet successfully with an older setup (probably the same GUI version but different patch level).
That means the system and authorization are fine — only the PI Sheet scripting interface seems broken now.

Here’s what I’ve already checked:

  • ✅ Client-side scripting is enabled (Options > Accessibility & Scripting > Enable Scripting)

  • ✅ Server-side parameter sapgui/user_scripting = TRUE

  • 🖥️ Other SAP transactions (like ME21N, CO03, etc.) can be recorded without any problem

  • ⚠️ Only PI Sheet fails to generate any script output

My question is:
👉 Is this a known limitation or bug in certain SAP GUI 7.70 patch levels?
👉 Which patch level or configuration allows PI Sheet scripting again?
👉 Do I need to downgrade or upgrade the GUI (e.g., Patch Level 15 or GUI 8.00)?

Any advice or workaround would be greatly appreciated!
Thank you very much in advance.

Best regards,
Sosan

entry.title: Opportunity to Shape the Future of Compatible Unit Management!
entry.content:
SAP's Customer Engagement Initiatives (CEI) platform, found at https://influence.sap.com, empowers SAP customers and partners by offering early access to SAP product developments. As a participant, you have the opportunity to interact directly with SAP product experts to influence future product direction.

As a part of CEI, we are launching a strategic initiative to transform and standardize Compatible Unit (CU) management across industries. This is a unique chance to collaborate on reimagining how CUs are defined, managed, and executed—making them more agile, scalable, and aligned with evolving customer needs.

🔍 Project Highlights:

  • Standardize CU practices to ensure consistency and interoperability across industries.
  • Align CU processes with customer-specific scenarios, enhancing relevance and usability.
  • Explore short-term and long-term solutions including:
    • CU integration into maintenance orders
    • Phase-based CU processes
    • Advanced execution capabilities

🎯 Expected Outcomes, but not limited to:

  • Simplified unit-based work design
  • Streamlined creation of maintenance orders
  • Scalable CU framework adaptable across industries

🛠️ SAP Product in Focus: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
🗓️ Estimated Effort: 4–6 hours/month
🗣️ Language: English
📍 Format: Calls, workshops, usability testing, and site visits (as available)

We’re looking for customers to join us in validating ideations, brainstorming use cases, and shaping the future of CU.

👉Here is the link to register yourselves: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/4035, Registration Dates Oct 13, 2025 to Nov 14, 2025

#SAP #S4HANA #CompatibleUnits #DigitalTransformation #IndustryInnovation #CustomerCollaboration #AssetManagement #ProductDevelopment #Cuustomer Engagement Initiative

entry.title: Re: Difference in SAP Integration Suite for SAP SuccessFa...
entry.content:
The main distinction between SAP Integration Suite for SuccessFactors and SAP Integration Suite – Standard Edition lies in their licensing scope and feature entitlements, particularly in how integration between SuccessFactors and other systems is packaged and priced.

Key Differences & Customer Benefits

Aspect Integration Suite for SuccessFactors Integration Suite – Standard Edition
Target Use CaseTailored for organizations that primarily need to integrate SuccessFactors with other SAP or non-SAP systemsGeneral-purpose integration across cloud, on-prem, and hybrid landscapes
Cost & LicensingUsually offered at a lower entry cost when your primary integration use case is SuccessFactors-centricBroader license covering more capabilities; more expensive but more flexible
Feature CoverageMay include pre-built integration content / connectors specific to SuccessFactorsFull access to Integration Suite’s capabilities: Cloud Integration, API Management, Open Connectors, etc. SAP Community+2SAP+2
Scalability & FlexibilityGood for a constrained integration landscape focused on HR data flowsIdeal when your integration needs expand across business units, applications, and domains
Upgrade PathYou may need to upgrade or augment to access full suite featuresAlready includes the full feature set and can scale with your needs SAP Community+1

From a customer perspective, if your integration footprint is limited to SuccessFactors and a few connected systems, the specialized package might give you cost advantages while satisfying your use case. But if you foresee needing broader integrations across ERP, CRM, third-party cloud apps, or extension services, the Standard Edition gives you more flexibility without needing add-ons later.

In my SAP certification preparations, I’ve seen scenarios where clients started with a narrow license and later faced additional costs to “unlock” full integration features. Using materials from Pass4Future helped me understand how to map business integration needs to the correct SAP licensing choice, aligning architectural decisions with license boundaries.

For official reference, you can review:

  • SAP’s Integration Suite product page: “SAP Integration Suite” SAP 

  • SAP’s pricing and editions documentation: “SAP Integration Suite Pricing” SAP+1 

Let me know if you want help modeling your expected integration use cases so you pick the right license from the start.

entry.title: Stock on Posting Date Report Showing Inconsistent Values in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
We are experiencing a critical data consistency issue with the Stock on Posting Date report. The report shows different closing stock values when executed simultaneously across multiple user sessions, despite no manual entries being passed by the team.

Observations

Scenario 1: Sequential Retrievals (Same Login)

 

First retrieval: 1,433,243,957 units

Second retrieval: 1,433,223,314 units

Difference: 20,643 units

Time interval: 2 minutes

No manual entries were posted between retrievals

 

Scenario 2: Simultaneous Multi-Session Execution

 

Ran the same report simultaneously on 3-4 different (or same) user logins

Each session returned different stock values from the same report

No parameter variations were made

 

Questions & Concerns

 

Why does the same report show different values when run simultaneously across different sessions? This suggests either a data consistency issue or query execution problem rather than timing-related variance.

What could cause a 20,643 unit variance within a 2-minute interval when no manual transactions have been posted?

Is this expected behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, or does this indicate:

 

Database lock contention or transaction isolation issues?

Uncommitted transactions being read differently by different sessions?

Cache synchronization problems?

Authorization/User Exit filtering differences?

 

 

 

Investigation Performed

 

Confirmed no manual journal entries or goods movements were posted by the team during the test period

Verified that all report executions used identical parameters and variant settings

Confirmed the issue occurs consistently across multiple simultaneous sessions

#SAP-S4HANA-Cloud #Inventory #Stock-Management #Data-Consistency #Reporting

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud: カスタムデータプロダクトの作成
entry.content:
はじめに

SAP Business Data CloudではSAPのビジネスアプリケーション間のデータを共通のデータモデルとしてデータセットおよびセマンティック（項目名の用語や意味合い）を整え、SAP データプロダクトとして提供します。これによりSAPのアプリケーションのデータは自動的にコピーされ、メタデータも併せてSAPがメンテナンスをしていきますが、S/4HANAのアドオンテーブルやカスタムCDS view、SAP以外のデータソースなどお客様独自の要件データソースに対してはカスタムデータプロダクトを作成することで、同様のフレームワークに組み込むことが可能です。

これによりSAPアプリケーションのデータだけでなく、SAP以外のデータも整備しAIエージェントに必要なデータとして提供できるため、ダッシュボードでデータを可視化するだけではなく、Jouleを使いながら対話形式でさらなるデータ分析の深堀やインサイトを得るなどデータ活用の幅を広げることができます。

そのような独自要件に則ったカスタムデータプロダクトの作成はSAP Datasphereの機能を用いて行いますが、本ブログではカスタムデータプロダクトの作成を解説いたします。

概要

本ブログではS/4HANA on-premiseから連携したCDS viewをベースとするカスタムデータプロダクトの作成を想定し解説いたします。SAP以外のデータソースが対象となる場合でも同様の手順でカスタムデータプロダクトの作成が可能です。

大まかなカスタムデータプロダクトの作成手順は以下の通りです。

entry.title: Re: Condition type change not creating change documents i...

entry.title: Re: SAP BPA Desktop Agent Installation Error : "The integ...
entry.content:
follow these instruction:Registry key to add before launching Agent installation process

Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Desktop Agent

 Key : Chk_MT (String type)

Value : false

Please follow this process

Uninstall manually the Agent (if still there)
Add the key Chk_MT inside the registry
Launch the installation of your Agent as “per machine” (installation choice only available by launching the .exe with admin rights)

follow these instruction : Registry key to add before launching Agent installation process

 Key : Chk_MT (String type)

Uninstall manually the Agent (if still there)
Add the key Chk_MT inside the registry
Launch the installation of your Agent as “per machine” (installation choice only available by launching the .exe with admin rights)

entry.title: Re: 1,500× Faster: ABAP Cloud API with “Just” Gzip
entry.content:
@natanael1 

  1. OData medium is JSON (or Atom XML which is deprecated since V4.0). How else than Base64 can you send compressed data via OData? I mean, what's better?
  2. It was just a guess, please forget it: I read too late that the magic would be with Transfer-Encoding, not with Content-Encoding, but if I believe rfc2616 - Content-Encoding vs Transfer Encoding in HTTP - Stack Overflow, "Transfer Encodings other than "chunked" (sadly) aren't implemented in practice". If I understand well, the header field "Transfer-Encoding: chunked" is implemented by the HTTP server or client, not by the receiving application, while Content-Encoding (like Content-Type and the rest of the message) is an information to be used or not by each client or server, and so it could be absent if the payload is always gzipped and the receiving application knows that and does the ungzip systematically.

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to dynamically change the names and le...
entry.content:
@Tano_B 
Thank you for your reply.

I created it based on the information you provided, and I was able to get close to what I wanted to achieve.
However, some of it was different from what we wanted to achieve.

It's great that the text from the input control is used to describe the measure item.
However, it did not cover the fact that measure items are added without editing when new data is added.
For the input control, I think it will need to be edited (added) each time new data is added.
For example, when data for the year 2026 is entered, I want it to automatically display "measure (2026)".
To achieve this, I think the input control will need to automatically change from the current date.

When I tried it with an input control, I was able to achieve "this year (2025) based on the system date" by specifying "0 years in the past and 0 years in the future from the system date (2025)."



Similarly, to achieve "last year (2024) based on the system date," I needed to specify "1 year in the past and -1 year in the future from the system date (2025)."
However, I was unable to specify "-1 year in the future," because negative values ​​are not allowed.

Do you know how to solve these problems?

Thanks & Regards,
tsuuuu

entry.title: Field Level Infotype Update with Business Integration Builder
entry.content:
Business Context

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) serves as the system of record for core HR data, including the attributes necessary to manage an employee’s lifecycle processes, such as hiring, changes in job and personal information, and more. In contrast, the payroll system is responsible for managing compliance-related data, including tax details, social insurance information, garnishments, and other statutory or regulatory requirements.

Employee data maintained in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central is replicated to the relevant Infotypes in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA. A single Infotype could have some fields being replicated form Employee central and a few payroll relevant fields that are not captured in Employee Central. Previously if such payroll relevant data was manually entered in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA for fields belonging to an Infotype which is replicated from Employee Central, then manual entries was overwritten the next time data was replicated from Employee Central. As a result, customers often had to exclude such Infotypes from their replication scope and maintain them completely in the backend Payroll system either by using SAP GUI transactions or UI mashups. With this approach customers were unable to use the full flexibility of Employee Central as the modern cloud based HR system.

Field Level Infotype Update : Solution Overview

 Employee master data replication from Employee Central using Business Integration Builder (BIB) now supports Field-Level Infotype Updates, enabling the partial replication of Infotype data from Employee Central without overwriting payroll-relevant Infotype fields maintained in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA.

Due to this newly introduced flexibility in master data replication, the data cut can now be configured at Infotype field level. You can now use Employee Central to maintain data of the available fields while entering the missing payroll-relevant fields of that infotype in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4HANA, either by using SAP GUI transactions or infotype UI mashups. The replication preserves existing payroll-related data, merges it with the incoming data from Employee Central, and updates the infotype with the combined details. This ensures you can use full capabilities of Employee Central as your cloud-based HR system and bring additional Infotypes in your replication scope.

Solution Status and Scope for 2H 2025

This feature of partial replication with field level Infotype update generally available with 2H 2025 release in :-

  • Support Package 40 of SFSF EC INTEGRATION (PA_SE_IN) add-on
  • Support Package 06 of SFSF EC S4 HCM INTEGRATION (ECS4HCM) add-on

For more details, refer to the What's New Viewer, ECS4HCM Help Guide, PA_SE_IN Help Guide.

The payroll relevant fields can now be protected during replication for the following Infotypes and their corresponding secondary Infotypes :-

  • Infotype 0001 (Organizational Assignment)
  • Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements)

This feature is intended for customers running payroll in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4HANA who are either beginning their Employee Central implementation or have already implemented it and want to broaden its usage scope.

To preserve historical Infotype data maintained in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA, it is recommended to use Field Level Infotype Update in combination with Infotype Specific Full Transmission Start Date functionality that is also introduced in 2H 2025.

Configuration Requirements

  • Set the constant value of EC to ERP: Don't overwrite Payroll related Infotype fields option in view  V_ECPAO_CONSTANTS to X.
  • Define the payroll-relevant fields of Infotype 0001 (Org Assignment) and Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements) that should be protected during employee master data replication from Employee Central, using the view ECPAO_INFTY_FLD available under Customizing for Business Integration Builder.

The below screenshots illustrates how to configure this :-

 

Subtypes and Country Grouping fields are optional. If a particular field is relevant for all countries, then this should be empty.

Fields belonging to Custom Includes can be configured in this customizing for Field Level Infotype Update and protected during replication.

If an Infotype field is already mapped in the Transformation Template Group used for employee data replication, it should not be included in the Field-Level Infotype Update configuration. Doing so will cause replication errors due to data conflicts.

Additionally, it is recommended to exclude Infotype fields that are derived by the HCM Framework.

Use Case Example

Let’s take an example with Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements)

The following configuration ensures that fields KGZFR (Sick Pay Supplement Period Number) and KGZZH (Sick Pay Supplement Period Unit) are protected during replication for employees belonging to Germany :-

Consider the following scenario involving sequential actions in Employee Central and SAP S4 HANA system:

  1. Hire an employee in Germany effective January 1, 2024, assigning Contract Type as Permanent.         
  2. After replication, enter the following values directly into Infotype 0016 in the Payroll system (PA30 or Infotype UI mashups):
    • Sick Pay Supplement Period Number: 3
    • Sick Pay Supplement Period Unit: months                                                                                                     
  3. Update the employee’s contract type to Part-time in EC by creating a new record in Job Information, effective from June 1, 2024.                                                                                                              
  4. After the next replication:
    • A new time slice is created in Infotype 0016, effective from June 1, 2024, with the Contract Type updated to Part-time.                                      
    • The existing values of KGZFR and KGZFH fields are retained in the existing time-slice and carry forwarded to the new time-slice effective from June 1, 2024.

The following visual illustrates how BIB replication works now with Field Level Infotype Update :-

Key Benefits

  • Maximize Cloud Capabilities: Extend your cloud footprint by leveraging the full potential of Employee Central as the core HR system of record.
  • Reduce Operational Costs  : Avoid embedding complex business logic or unnecessary custom fields in Employee Central for data that belongs to Payroll domain and not relevant for running core HR business processes.
  • Establish Role-Based Data Governance : Establish clear boundaries between HR and Payroll teams, allowing each to manage data relevant to their domain, improving governance and operational efficiency.
  • Seamless Data Continuity During Payroll System Upgrade : A consistent data cut between Core HR and Payroll ensures a smooth and reliable transition from SAP ERP HCM to SAP S/4 HANA on-premise or SAP S/4 HANA Private Cloud Edition.

Conclusion: 

We truly value your feedback on this new functionality and would love to hear your thoughts on which additional Infotypes you would like to see supported, beyond Infotype 0001 (Organizational Assignment) and Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements).

Please feel free to share your suggestions, requirements, or expectations in the comments section. Your input plays a key role in shaping future enhancements, and we look forward to collaborating with you to improving our solution.
